website_summaries.verdict: The best budget fat tire bike for men looking to get into off-road riding without spending too much.
pros: Large 26-inch tires feature good tread for extra grip on rough terrain
Frame is solid with durable connections
7-speed rear gearing offers plenty low-gear help
cons: Lacks any sort of suspension to smooth out rough rides and jumps while off road

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike! I get looks and smiles whenever I ride it. Easy assemble. HEAVY box. Good thick tires with lots of tread. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: DallasDevilDog

customer_reviews.title: Best bike I've owned so far
customer_reviews.text: Best bike I've owned so far. Love it, switches gears pretty easily. The bike came mostly assembled and tires inflated. Goes great on trails or cement. Can't wait to try it on sand. I like that I'm not limited to one time of the year with this bike. I always get compliments on the looks.
customer_reviews.author: StorminsTheCat

customer_reviews.title: Fat Tire bike that won't break the bank
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first, I love the look of fat tire bikes, but I have heard they are heavy for normal use. After receiving this bike and having ridden it all summer long, I have to say I am glad I bought it. The disc brakes are nice, this is the first bike I've had with disc brakes and they work very well. It isn't too heavy for everyday use, and handles sand and loose dirt really well. If you're looking for a decent fat tire bike that isn't going to break the bank, this is a great start.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Korfias Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great Starting platform for my ebike!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this bike as the starting point for my custom ebike build. I chose it because of the steel frame and price. After some much needed modifications of coursez it's starting to shape up into something very fun! My only real complain about this bike is the brakes. They were very inadequate for the bike in it's original form, and now that I have added so much weights they really do not perform at all. I will be switching to 203mm hydraulica over the winter from the 160mm mechanical that came with the bike. But for such a cheap price, how can I complain?
customer_reviews.author: delta_grimes

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Bike is easy to assemble, but you definitely get what you pay for in terms of quality. Good: I’m 250 pounds and these tires are so large that even the largest pot wholes are handled with ease. Bad: the seat it comes with was built for a road/speed bike, meaning it’s tiny. In addition, the brakes on this bike are not large enough, so make sure you get some practice in an open space to get use to how early you need to apply the brakes based on speed. Lastly the grip handles are smaller than normal, if you have normal or large size hands, get ready to feel some discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Los

customer_reviews.title: other than that it's a great bike.
customer_reviews.text: my boyfriend put it together in a short amount of time. He gets SO many compliments and inquiries about this bike because it's so unique looking with the fat tires. We made some alterations....immediately ordered a wide, cruiser-type seat, so we didnt even attach the original one. Plus we got wider pedals in red that make the bike pop with color. I haven't had the chance to ride it yet, but he says the only downfall is the weight...other than that it's a great bike.
customer_reviews.author: uh...what

customer_reviews.title: cheap parts on good frame, needs to be broken down and reassembled
customer_reviews.text: well first off its not a real mongoose, they sold their name. The frame and fork seem nice, and the wheels ain't bad either> The complaints I do have is the bottom bracket / bearing set is junk, I never seen suck a cheap derailer/gear shifting mechanism, and the rear spool sounds like its grinding stones. yet all upgrade-able. the other parts are as expected for price, good enough for now. all the bearings have to be cleaned and repacked, they have metal shavings in them and petroleum jelly for grease. otherwise I am very happy for what I spent. toss a couple bucks at it and it will take a beating
customer_reviews.author: ironhammer

customer_reviews.title: Bought two bikes and 1 came with deformed bike fork
customer_reviews.text: I got two bikes and the first one bike came with a malformed fork!!! Do you know how much stress this caused me??? The instruction booklet is not well written and the people on YOUTUBE who THINK they are giving helpful and informative information are merely wasting your time. I put the 2nd bike together in twenty minutes but now I had to buy a higher priced bike to replace the first one. I think amazon should reimburse me for a free bike for all the stress I’ve been through which includes trying to prepare a bike to be put back in a box for UPS pick up.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Bonsai novice

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I'm not exactly a beginner but I think it's been close to 20 years since I last rode a bike. I'm 5'3 so this is a bit scary at first. My husband adjusted the seat to the lowest level and my toes still barely reach the ground. If you're shorter, I won't recommend especially if you're a beginner. It took a couple of tries for my confidence to come back. The seat was a pain in the butt, literally. I replaced it with the c9 from sunlite (i think that's the brand). So much better! Overall, I love my fat bike. I haven't gone off roading yet, but we'll see how long this will last on regular road.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Sweet wheels
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful bike, was more than impressed with the look of the bike. Immediately changed the set to a bigger one just because I needed to, but original seems comfortable. Easy to set up I took a little longer than needed since I did not want to scratch it. One tire was about 10lbs under inflated but I had a pump no problem. It's not an easy bike to peddle. Heavy bike but so am I so it's good, even the regular hills will give you a workout. Maybe if it had 12 speeds and not seven but I still love the bike, got plenty of compliments while riding.
customer_reviews.author: AXEL RAMOS

customer_reviews.title: Lousy gear ratio range
customer_reviews.text: My big complaint is the lack of gear choice for climbing even a very slight hill. In contrast, I have a much more expensive fat tire bicycle with a gearing range that allows climbing almost anything. Additionally, as you'd expect for the price, nothing about this bicycle is above minimal quality. I got mine to ride on the beach, and for it is at least practical: The gear range is adequate for the absolutely level grade, and I won't mind eventually discarding it when the harsh, salty environment does it in.
customer_reviews.author: Morseguy

customer_reviews.title: get it with the right expectations
customer_reviews.text: it's fun if you are prepared to take it apart, grease, and retune anything that moves or is adjustable. After riding for a couple of weeks the back hub is seizing, but that might be me not having a freewheel puller to grease right side bearings. The bike is HEAVY, but fun around the city and in the snow and you get a good workout just pedaling around. It is an inexpensive entry level fat tire bike and takes the same attention as any inexpensive entry level item. I got what was expected and am happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: bobkacz

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike and price
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this as prime. According to the information provided it was heavy and thus wouldn't come in two days. Took about a week. Arrived with box damaged. Contents were fine. Assembled easily. Rides nice. After a few trips have to readjust most of the components to ensure proper use such as gears and breaks. Added head and tail light along with other accessories. I would recommend this bike to anyone looking for an inexpensive bike for casual riding. I believe I will upgrade the gears and the seat and probably invest in some quick release bike hubs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: x21ironsides

customer_reviews.title: Wheels not tru from factory
customer_reviews.text: Bike wheels came in not trued. shipped from manufacturer this way. Unfortunately I paid to have it assembled and now cant return, so have to pay bikeshop to correct. Very dissapointing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: seems like nice bike, but packaging sucks
customer_reviews.text: Bike came, slower than usual. box was crushed and torn. almost looks like it had been opened and sent back as it was fully taped up also. 2 of the front wheel spokes were bent, ripping one of them out of the rim compeletly. I can probably fix the rim and straighten the spokes and re true the wheel, but for the price, I really shouldn't have to. other than that, it was easy to assemble, just straighten neck and attach handlebars, seat and front wheel. good looking bike. we'll see if it holds up to any riding.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Bootsma

customer_reviews.title: This bike is a TANK
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6' and 290 pounds, and I bought this guy after having multiple other bikes give out on me. No fear with this one. It definitely weighs somewhere over 40 pounds, and takes effort to get moving compared tu other bikes, but if you're using it for exercise, (like me,) I'd view that as a plus. The only downside I've encountered is that the tires are so wide that you can't lean the bike when you pedal. I'm used to standing when I ride and leaning the entire bicycle back and forth when I extend my legs, which isn't possible here. Took less than an hour to assemble, needed brakes tightened, and off I went. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew May

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty easy to assemble and it's gorgeous but there's a ...
customer_reviews.text: This Mongoose flat tire bike is no joke! It's pretty easy to assemble and it's gorgeous but there's a catch, it's tough on the upper thigh area when you ride it. Now it's been awhile since l've rode a bike, so it's going to take -some- getting use too. Never the less I love this bike, and it makes anyone look cool riding it.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing ride and built for big riders
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bike for 300lb rider. The bike seat is very narrow so not very comfortable for beginners. Gave 4 stars due to paint scratching very easily. Leaves grooves in the paint if you aren't the top most delicate one can be at all times. Smooth ride, nice tires and frame. Easy shifting gears during ride. The bike seat pole is not standard, you have to measure the correct bar fitting if you order after market Bike Seat. The YLG oversized saddle seat we tried on bike fell down due to bar size being too narrow to fit. Ylg worked great on schwinn ladies bike.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bicycle
customer_reviews.text: One of the greatest bicycles I have ever ridden, truly astounding and very, very durable. This bike I would say is a pleasure riding and in fact a privilege. This bike can go very fast despite its weight and tire size. Another great feature is the gear selection, perfect for changing speed and traction. I have ridden very fast at with this bike so far and am not dissatisfied. It’s very easy to clean and not at all hard to handle. This bike is sure to get you looks of admiration and can also go on basic off road terrain although I would not recommend going on hard snow.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this bike for a few weeks, it was delivered MUCH FASTER than the 2 months it was originally scheduled to take. Easy assembly, and everything works! Have only had limited time to ride as the weather in Florida has not cooperated, but for the few times I have been able to ride, it handles well and rides smooth. Not going to use this for mountain biking, just regular "cruiser" riding. Since I'm a larger guy, 6'2" and 365 lbs., there are things I had to change, such as the seat (Cloud 9), but the stock seat would be good for most people.
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: Great bike but needs better quality control
customer_reviews.text: I love the bike. But gave it a 3 star because it was missing the adjustable seat bolt *see photo. With out it you can't ride the bike. I had to go to Walmart and buy some bolts to be able to ride the bike. Disappointed on the factthat's an important part to the bike and there was no quality control for it. Also the front reflector was missing. I did like the fact that there was minor assembly required with minimal tools needed. Company should provide the necessary Allen wrenches.which they don't...I will contact Amazon to see if the company will send me the missing bolt..
customer_reviews.author: Joseph cintron

customer_reviews.title: Good bike!
customer_reviews.text: First, these tires are huge! I just want to say anyone who has this bike, or, is buying it, grease the bearings. All of them were completely dry. This means that the bottom bracket, headset, and wheel hubs have to be taken apart and cleaned. Then grease and reassemble. This is the price we pay for buying online and not at a shop. There are videos on YouTube that are specific to the Mongoose fat tire bikes. Easy. Overall it’s a good bike for the money, just make sure to grease the bearings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bent frame/rear
customer_reviews.text: This is completely ridiculous. I just assembled this bike after delivery and and I heard I wierd noise thinking it would go away however the problem was the frame was bent on the rear... lucky a local bike shop knew how to repair this because I didn’t want to wait to send it back and wait for another one.. I still had to to pay the shop for fixing a “ a brand new bike”
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Entry level Fat Tire Bike can't be beat
customer_reviews.text: The bike arrived with major box damage. Fortunately the contents were fine. Assembled very easily. Rides smooth, but be sure you want a heavy bike because uphill on this bike will give you a work out. After riding for a few trips had to readjust most of the components to ensure proper alignment such as gears and breaks. Spokes did not need adjustment. Added mirror, new seat, and head and tail light along with other minor accessories. I would recommend this bike to anyone looking for an inexpensive fat tire bike. For the price this cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Good trail bike
customer_reviews.text: This bike is exactly what I was looking for, something to ride without the temptation of jumping everything in sight. The bike is a little on the heavy side, and its all tire/wheel, so it keeps you planted pretty well. Rides smooth. The seat is a little hard, and the brakes are drastically under sized, but it gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Grandpa Loves His New Toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Grandpa Needed A New Toy, soooo.........Got An All-Terrain Mongoose Fat Tire Bike to Compliment My 6'2......Fat Profile. Arrived in One Box, Well Packaged. Assembled Seat, Pedals, Handled Bar, Front Tire, Added A Water Bottle Holder On Tube and a Coffee Cup Holder on Handlebars. Centered Handlebars to Front Wheel, Tested Brakes, and Made Riding Position Adjustment. Took less than an hour and Hit The Maiden Voyage Thru Town. Grammar School Kids Saw The Bike and Gave Me Thumbs Up as I passed them at their recess/outdoor gym classes. Great Bike, Solid, and Great Value......already planning several riding excursions for Saturday, Sunday, Monday and Tuesday. 64 Year Young Kid!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Swede

customer_reviews.title: unusable bike
customer_reviews.text: We ended up waiting until the weather improved so I just put the bike together after sitting at my house for 35 days. The front sprocket is broken and bent terribly so the bike is totally unusable. It is past the 30 day return window.
customer_reviews.author: fridayhill

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: The bike is great so far. Great ride, lots of fun. Feels very stable and safe. I strongly suggest a better seat, the one it comes with was painful to both me and my wife. As we are both tall I added an extension to raise the handle bars too. These customizations were easy to execute.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Collins

customer_reviews.title: After assembly, had to adjust shifting mechanism (derailleur). Not easy!
customer_reviews.text: Bike seems to be pretty durable, but not satisfied as for the fact I had to figure out how to adjust the rear derailleur as the chain was skipping and popping. Then today, the second day of use, the rear tire popped. The tube inside has a hole. No damage to the tire. Going to change the tube myself. I hope nothing else goes wrong within the next week or I will definitely be lowering the rating.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Fat man and his fat bike
customer_reviews.text: Great bike! Got this to get active and it rides great. I’m a heavy guy and I feel like this bike won’t flatten like a pancake. Seriously, being 340 I needed this bike to be something of biblical proportions to support my fat arse. The mongoose Dolomite feels Sturdy and made well. The only issue so far is the rubbing sound on the front tire which again I would think would be all the weight however this issue happened installing the wheel on it. Other than that it’s fine.
customer_reviews.author: Swoof!

customer_reviews.title: Beefy Bike
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit of a husker and this bike has held up great!! 6' 240 lbs and this bike fits just great! The assembly is super easy. I will say that this is an absolutely great starter/beginner bike but don't expect high quality. This bike is mostly made out of steel rather that aluminum so it is very heavy. I would suggest upgrading the pedals and handle bars pretty quick as they are both pretty low quality.
customer_reviews.author: stanley forbes

customer_reviews.title: A great value
customer_reviews.text: I read many of reviews for this bike and was confused whether I should buy it or not. I wanted a bike so I took the chance and bought it. Easy to assemble, extremely well packed. I’m 65 years old 6’2” 215 pounds. I fit it perfectly! Single packed sturdy box, no rips or tears; perfect condition. My wife is going to try the bike this weekend. If she likes the ride, I’ll order another bike for her.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Boyd

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for & then some. Horrible customer service from Mongoose
customer_reviews.text: Had to take it in to local bike shop to repair the derailleur and gear shift out of box. Not a cheap repair for a "new" bike!! Mongoose cust svc did nothing to help because they claimed I must've bent the derailleur, or gear sprockets during unboxing and assembly. There were two of us here unboxing and assembling so care was taken. Amazon, please review your relationship with Mongoose, you don't want customers turned away due to a vendor's bad customer service and poor quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Nick R

customer_reviews.title: More time with my son
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. Packed very well for protecting the surfaces. Rides very comfortable through grass and on hard surfaces. A more comfortable seat will need to be purchased but I'm still using the original as of now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Morrison

customer_reviews.title: What a great buy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great buy, I'm 290lb and I'm able to ride this bike just fine! also took me only 20 min to put this together, I wasn't even trying to hurry. I had to adjust the brakes so that it stopped with me on the bike as I am 6' 2'' and 290lb but it was nice and easy to adjust the brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.text: The bike took forever to arrive, long after it was promised. It said only handlebars, seat and pedals needed installing. Sadly, I also had to take it in because the disc brakes were not functioning properly. After all of the waiting and then more waiting and spending more money to get brakes fixed on a brand new bike, my enthusiasm has waned.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike
customer_reviews.text: Wow what an amazing bike. I bought this as a big man trying to get into biking and exercising. I couldn't be happier. There are a few changes I had to make to the bike to get comfortable. First I replaced the seat with a schwinn wide seat and the seat post for a ganoper with a different mounting bracket for the seat. I then got handlebars with a higher rise so I could sit more comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Check all parts upon receiving.
customer_reviews.text: Bike arrived, no problem. Assembly was very simple. Went to ride bike and handlebars would turn but front wheel wouldn't. No matter how much I try I cannot tighten It so the handlebars are locked in place. Screw appears to be turning and locking but the apparatus that should be locked does not lock. For some asinine reason I am not able to contact the seller
customer_reviews.author: I just don't care anymore

customer_reviews.title: Front Bearings
customer_reviews.text: The bike came beautifully packed and crated...absolutely no damage. It went together quickly and appeared to be fully ready to ride. I noticed a clicking in the front wheel area. I dismantled the axle assembly and found only 4 ball bearings on one side...should be 8. Ancillary comment...the bike is very heavy and rugged so don't expect to horse it around.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike but having trouble with the derailer.
customer_reviews.text: I would love to give this bike 5 stars but the gears aren't working correctly when they're supposedly pre-adjusted. But it doesn't like to stay in 1st and, skips 2nd and 4th. I haven't tried the instructions for adjusting the gears but I'm pretty disappointed that I even have to deal with this issue. Other than that, the bike is great and I'm sure I'll be happy with it as soon as I get the derailer working correctly.
customer_reviews.author: calijeeprat

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: The price is outstanding. At bike stores this sort of bike would run into the thousands. Yes it’s big and heavy, but it cruises very nicely on the streets, and bumps are not too bad. Great bike. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Kaufhold

customer_reviews.title: Plus size ppl, this is your bike!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is outstanding! I've had it for about 4 weeks now and ride it all the time. I was looking for a bike that would support my weight and not in the $1,000 range. I am 350lbs and I don't have any issues on this. Plus size people looking to get active, this is for you! When I'm on the trail I always get compliments on it.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the $$ but HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: I got this bike because there is a lot of sugar sand where I live. The tires and the gears make this bike a perfect cheap alternative in the fat tire market. This bike is WAY heavier than it needs to be, however. If you are planning on putting this in a car mounted bike rack frequently this may not be the one for you. If you don't have to manhandle your bike then this will save you a lot of cash.
customer_reviews.author: bizzlesnach

customer_reviews.title: OHHH BOY!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike! I had my cousin out together because he works in a bike shop so can't really speak about how easy to put it together but even still it only took him about 15 minutes to complete. The bike looks really cool and it's definitely a head turner! I've only rode a couple of times and I'm a 300 on guy but really comfortable and feels solid. Seems like will stand the test of time. Can't beat for the money!
customer_reviews.author: bigfunkylizard

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to assemble and arrived safely with no damage to the package. My only complaint and I believe it may have been a manufacturing issue were that the front brakes were locked (not assembled correctly) where I couldn't put the front wheel on. I had to take the brakes apart and readjust.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Sturdy, Holds the big guys!
customer_reviews.text: Bike holds over 400 pounds easy, just have to tighten seat so it don’t sink all the way down. Heavy sturdy and can handle the big guys! Worth the money if you are a big guy trying to move around and loosen up. Beginner to help lose weight and start the process. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: JarretTaylor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bike for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this bike a couple of months now and I really like it! For the price this is a great value. For a beginner to assemble I did run into a few bumps in the road, it helped watching videos on Youtube of others putting it together. You will need some basic tools. The bike tires are awesome. The gears shifting are slightly clunky at times. The seat is very basic. This bike looks awesome and I have gotten lots of compliments on it. Check out my video review!
customer_reviews.author: Lucas A. Ducklow

customer_reviews.title: Little too small for a 6 foot tall person.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great bike for the price, but too small for a 6 foot tall person. Also, it really doesn't seem to go through snow better than my regular mt bike. *Edit: I put a longer seatpost on the bike and it seems like it's going to be trail-worthy.
customer_reviews.author: The Real Me

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: At $350, its hard to complain about this bike. It's very sturdy, and holds my fat self on it without an issue. I hadn't assembled a bike in a long time, but the manual helped get it in a working condition, along with some youtube videos for calibrating the brakes. Some of the parts on the bike are kind of cheap, but that's to be expected at this price. If you get this, be prepared to spend a few bucks on a new seat at the minimum. Otherwise for the price i've had a blast driving this thing around, i haven't really taken it offroad, been mostly using it to cruise trails/roads.
customer_reviews.author: Oogle

customer_reviews.title: Front brake arrived bent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this used from Amazon Warehouse. Brake in front wheel was bent, had to take it off. Not super happy but too much trouble to return. Works okay without front brake. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ClAy

customer_reviews.title: Big, beefy fun!
customer_reviews.text: Fat tire is popular for a reason and to see a 26" fat tire this well constructed sell for ~$300--hats off to Mongoose on this one! You may want to replace stock stem down the line and if you do any type of terrain riding--grab you a suspension fork somewhere--but if you are looking to give fat tire a whirl this entry-level build is one worth considering.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Broadaway

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I received the product damaged so badly that I cannot even mount the front wheel.
customer_reviews.author: james Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Everything else was there and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this from an Amazon Warehouse deal and the bike seat was missing. Everything else was there and easy to put together. Amazon took care of me by crediting me back some money for a bike seat and now am very happy with it! Excellent fun bike that I hope to learn how to do fututre upgrades to and make lightier because it is kinda heavy to haul around. Great first Fat Tire Bike though!
customer_reviews.author: Goonie4Life

customer_reviews.title: It's fun cruising around
customer_reviews.text: All arrived as expected. I really appreciated the fact that it was re-boxed, so you couldn't tell what was really sitting on the door step. All went together as planned. Do read the reviews online for pointers, it helped. Bearings needed to be regreased and cones adjusted. And keep in mind, this is a low cost entry to a "fat tire bike". It's fun cruising around, but it is not built for a single track outing. But there is something about seeing those 4" tires that draws you to it. It was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: jhyatt

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Big fat bike turn heads everywhere i go! it was easy to assemble and rides very smooth. Made some upgrades though!
customer_reviews.author: KalnixW

customer_reviews.title: Uses some plastic pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I found assembly a bit of a challenge, but I was able to do it alone. Replaced original seat with a wider saddle. Doubt that it will be durable enough over time, but I do ride it. Works OK... Handle bars and breaks could be stronger.
customer_reviews.author: bendito

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price. Comes mostly assembled.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the baby blue one cuz i was kinda low on cash then. I painted it black and since it had yellow stickers i went with yellow rims. I like the 2 yellow strips i gave it on either sides of the stickers. It brings it all together. I used matte black and sun yellow spray paint. I added a clear coat to all the yellow parts.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, sturdy like a mongoose
customer_reviews.text: It looks goofy at first, big tire, bright blue paint job. But once you get on and realize it's not going to collapse under your titan of girth, you feel like a kid again, air whipping through your balding hair. You feel free, free from the mundane everyday life of an adult
customer_reviews.author: Richard McGrew

customer_reviews.title: Pretty tough bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty tough bike. I bought this bike because it was the cheapest bike that I thought would hold my 344lbs. I knew going in that I would be making upgrades as I went. The first three I recomend is the pedals, seat and shifter. Get out and ride!
customer_reviews.author: John Dempsey

customer_reviews.title: Good looking Bike
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking if you are not good at assembling things pay to have it put together. My husband is very mechanical and it took him awhile. Make sure to read directions Reflector on right completely before assembling. Hope it rides as good as it looks Has not been used yet waiting for Christmas reflctor on right pedal and handlebars arrived crackef not a big deal to me
customer_reviews.author: marian

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS BIKE!
customer_reviews.text: First off, this bike is amazing! I have been struggling for years to find a bike strong enough to hold me. I am 6'5 - 360lbs and push this bike to the limit! The Mongoose Dolomite doesnt even flinch under the pressure. At first, I was worried the large tires would make it hard to pedal on/off road. That is not the case at all! Top it all off, the bike is very good looking and constantly turning heads as I ride past. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Ok but mine has fallen apart a bit in a month
customer_reviews.text: Some of the bolts were really hard to get loosened in order to adjust the breaks. The directions were kind of complicated to follow. I have he mad the bike for maybe a month or so and the right pedal has come off twice and now the threading is stripped on the inside where the pedal connects.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Absolutely love this bike.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely absolutely love my new bike. This thing is a tank.
customer_reviews.author: Semper Fi'

customer_reviews.title: Bike in a box.
customer_reviews.text: The bike as a product is not what I am having a problem with. We have had to spend $150 so far on a $400 purchase for repairs. Buying a bike online and putting it together is not a easy thing for most people. The bike then developed a problem with the steering and threw him from the bike. He does not trust it anymore and now since we are a few months from the purchase we have no way of getting anything done about it. So to anyone reading this thinking about buying a bike online - DON'T -go to a bike shop who will gladly assist you with any issues and make adjustments as needed.
customer_reviews.author: RMueller

customer_reviews.title: Crankset broke after 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Crankset broke after 2 months of use. Too late to return now and cant find replacement crankset. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike because I am a bigger guy 6'4" 285Lbs and wanted something that could hold my weight. It is almost too big when the seat is all the way up. If you are looking for a bike that is heavy duty and is fun to ride, purchase this bike. Pros- Easy to Assemble/ Packaging/ Price Cons- Disc breaks needed lots of calibration/ heavy/ disc breaks don't stop bike quickly
customer_reviews.author: Philip M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality pedal assembly
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to get this bike. It lasted about a month and then both pedals began to become loose and bend. After removing both pedals, it became clear that the quality of the threaded metal inside was not the best quality and literally stripped away from daily use. I am 6' tall and 225; so nothing outside the specs as far as appropriate use. They did accept the return, even after five weeks. Hopefully they can adjust and upgrade, as it really is a great bike.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Polins

customer_reviews.title: Missing item
customer_reviews.text: Giving this a 1 star unless I can contact support. The package didn't include the front wheel axle nut. I went to a few stores but none of the axles were able to fit nicely I would have to force it and it would loosen up over time and ruin the bike. Other than that I think it's a good value for the money if you get all the parts in the package. I was testing the axle nuts outside and got many compliments from people passing by.
customer_reviews.author: Abderrahmane k.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bike, even for Big guys!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy bike. Even for big men like myself. If you're looking for a bike to get back into shape, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Free-Dawg

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT ENTRY-LEVEL!! NOT FOR CLASS 3 OFF-ROAD! GREAT STARTUP BIKE!
customer_reviews.text: CAME WITH NO PEDALS!!!! *However according to bike shop, more & more bike companies ship em with no pedals so you can pick what ya want! Brakes are cheapo-crap! Adjust is DEFINITELY a over statement! However for Entry-level, little component upgrading, NOT BAD START OFF BIKE AT ALL!! WONT be doing ANY stump-jumping or 70mph downhill trail rides with it, but for old-coot like myself just starting in whole "Fat Bike" (God sounds so mainstream and vanilla) it's great so far!
customer_reviews.author: Crucible7

customer_reviews.title: Sending back for different bike
customer_reviews.text: Got a bike that someone else had already put partially together (and didn't follow directions) and had a flat rear tire with a 2 inch puncture. I was contemplating taking it apart and starting over, but I'm annoyed that I have to figure out how to put some parts together on my own because it wasn't dismantled by the last guy in a way that I can follow the directions in the booklet. You shouldn't pay full price for something that someone else already sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish I purchased locally. Now I'm stuck with a bike Mongoose doesn't want to fix
customer_reviews.text: Put the bike together and have put 60 miles on it, now in the shop because I need to replace a crank arm due to the left pedal striping out the hole. Four day the bike would shift on it's own when peddeled heavily. Had to watch a video on how to tighten everything up on order to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: RobFlorida

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the money! Listed on the top 5 for under a "G"
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the money! A little heavy but not too bad, very minor adjustments needed to derailleur after assembly. Bars were too low for my liking added aftermarket 5 inch rise bars and a wider seat with some absorbers under it and a built in light. Gearing is good and goes through pretty much everything...
customer_reviews.author: Al Magnifico

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bike
customer_reviews.text: Bike arrived in a very secure package. Assembly was super easy. Bike is built exceptionally well and looks really Tough. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Richter

customer_reviews.title: Fat bike for fat people
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a bicycle so your fat husband can get healthy the way my daughter was, this is the bike for you. Well-constructed and easily assembled, your overweight loved one will be well on their way to the Cathy lab in no time. Mongoose bicycles have always been a quality product, and this is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: fast911

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike
customer_reviews.text: My father in law is a handy man and had no problem putting it together. I weigh 380 pounds and the bike handles me great!!! I would recommend if you are as big as me get a seat that in more comfortable. But I knew that before I bought so I got one anyway..
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Ride this bike 3 times before I had to get it fixed.
customer_reviews.text: The pedal crank broke costing me over $100 to fix. They make it impossible for you to fix at home. Also, the instruction wasn’t clear. It caused me to have my handle bars on wrong and the only reason why I found out was when I took it to the bike shop to fix the pedal. That’s when they told me.
customer_reviews.author: The Honorable Rico Smith

customer_reviews.title: good value.
customer_reviews.text: 11/3/2020 - Bike is strong and durable, holds a big hefty rider. 260lbs at almost 6ft. Easy to put together, mostly assembled already just a few tweaks needed. The disk brakes could use an upgrade thats for sure.. but for the 300 I paid for the bike I say it was worth it compared to other prices around. I read some horror reviews. But honestly thats usually the person who delivers fault for mishandling packages. my bike came in great shape. I recommend 👌
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS BIKE
customer_reviews.text: If you are coasting downhill, it feels like you are on a motorcycle - it goes downhill fast!! It's a nice workout on level ground and definitely a workout uphill! I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: This bike,my bike is a head Turner! THIS BIKE IS BOSS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am gassed! This bike is absolutely amazing I can't sum up enough words describe how happy I am. I thought I'd look good when I ordered it online but when it got delivered I was blown away cool super styler the bike is. The candy apple painting yes the fattest tires I've ever seen another guess love love love thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: J.Zimmerman III

customer_reviews.title: Built tough
customer_reviews.text: I’m 6’3” and I weigh 285 lbs add a little extra air to the tires and I did have to change the handle bars and seat but other than that I really enjoy my new bike rides smooth and looks cool I did however bend the peddles trying to race my kids over all I’m impressed with a few aftermarket add ons you’ll have a tough bike
customer_reviews.author: NC Swamp Man

customer_reviews.title: Inspect everything
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money, just plan to take everything apart and grease it. Front wheel bearing were missing a few ball bearings, most likely a factory fault. once I went through everything it rides nice and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: slavko

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The bike turned out to be a lot heavier than I had anticipated. Also, the pedal mechanism makes an annoying clicking sound every revolution. You really do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Almost no assembly required!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly even a 9 year old can handle. With help lifting obviously this thing is a beast. I would definitely order a better seat as I did like others have said it’s as hard as they come! This is a great bike with a great price I would highly recommended if your wanting to try out a fat tire without spending to much $$$
customer_reviews.author: Dan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bike Life
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this. We were fortunate to catch it on sale. He is 15, put it together himself. So if he can do it, you can do it.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Big bike for a big dude
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, handles my 6,3” height and big guy weight just fine. Looks awesome, people stop and look at the tires lol
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Elliott

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy bike, some improvement needed.
customer_reviews.text: Frame seems solid. Brakes very poor. My rear caliper stop working after three weeks . Leaver moves but no bite from disc. All terrain description is precise. Brakes is important. Hope Mongoose review it's operation.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: So happy with my choice.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. My only complaint is that a tall person ( I'm 6' 4") needs to add a riser extension to the handlebars. I purchased a 7" extension and the bike is perfect. I also upgraded the saddle to a more comfortable one. Easy assembly and adjustments. I am going to enjoy this bike for a long time. Already put 25 miles on it in the first week.
customer_reviews.author: James Luzzo

customer_reviews.title: I changed out the grips as i didn't like the twist shift and changed out the brake levers
customer_reviews.text: very heavy fat bike. I purchased it knowing the weight as i wanted a heavy bike to get more exercise. it's tough on steep hills but I have been enjoying it. I changed out the grips as i didn't like the twist shift and changed out the brake levers. also changed out the pedals as the ones that came with it were a little small for me. Tuning the gears is pretty easy. this is a fun bike learn to wrench on.
customer_reviews.author: Joon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Thus bike is a tank! Will handle any terrain you can throw at it but in long bike rides it will wear you out, bike slowed down fast but I love it thanks k you
customer_reviews.author: Eric Fisher

customer_reviews.title: As noted elsewhere the bearings on the front wheel were over tightened but after assembly this bike has gotten me through miles
customer_reviews.text: For the money you cannot beat this. As noted elsewhere the bearings on the front wheel were over tightened but after assembly this bike has gotten me through miles and miles of snow and ice very comfortably. Its no doubt harder to pump on regular pavement so its a good workout but its a kick to mow thru the cold stuff when you watch others in their mountain bikes and yes even road bikes struggle . Lots of fun to ride.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: Only bike you'll need
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting one of these bikes for awhile the only thing I didn't care for was the tiny seat. But it's fun to ride on the trails
customer_reviews.author: Terry bobulinski

customer_reviews.title: Feel like a kid again
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, so fun to ride, brings me back to being a kid, I am 6-2 and beefy, it holds me just fine
customer_reviews.author: BostonMike

customer_reviews.title: Fun to ride
customer_reviews.text: Havent been into biking since I was young and wanted to get back into it without spending an arm and a leg. This bike is so sweet especially for the price! Can't get anything as nice for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Funpain
customer_reviews.text: Get ready to build lol. It was fun. Get ready for a workout on higher gears, big tires take on any terrain, trails are no match. But i do feel bad for your butt... seat is as hard as they come and with no shocks, your looking at a serious problem if you like to remain seated off-road.
customer_reviews.author: Type1dieabetes

customer_reviews.title: Good bike
customer_reviews.text: With absolutely no mechanical know how I put this bike together it was very easy but the box itself is EXTREMELY hard to open because the super glued it shut the the only reason it's not 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous user

customer_reviews.title: great bike, bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: Bike is nice! Sturdy built and goes through three inches of new snow 10 minutes out of the box! I bought one for me and one for my wife. Mine is great! Five Stars! My wife's came without a seat, and the rear derailleur is bent beyond repair. Aside from that a few minor scratches. I guess that box got some rough treatment. It had been boxed inside another new box. Now I've got to disassemble it and jigsaw puzzle it back into the double box it came in so I can return it! One Star! Overall 3 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Provost

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice bike. Brakes kind of suck. Recommend upgrading those ASAP. But overall a solid bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jason McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike
customer_reviews.text: This has to be one of the most fun bike to ride. Not as smooth as a ten speed, but not as rough as a mountain bike. I have had this bike for sometime now, so I'm comfortable about giving it a good rating. No problems or issue so far.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert G

customer_reviews.title: It will last.
customer_reviews.text: Had a couple before,only way to go now,I'am 74 and this will help me get to75.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Red

product_meta.title: Mongoose Dolomite Fat Tire Mens Mountain Bike,17-Inch/Medium High-Tensile Steel Frame, 7-Speed, 26-inch Wheels
product_meta.description: For almost 40 years, Mongoose has been in the dirt, on the trails, and off the ramps. Founded in 1974 in a Southern California garage, Mongoose has always been an aggressive brand with products that push the limits of what a rider can do. Conquer any off-road trail with ease with this steel-framed mountain bike with supersized all-terrain knobby tires. A Shimano rear derailleur with seven speeds makes hills easier to climb, while twist shifters make it smooth and easy to change gears while riding. The threadless headset is adjustable for riders of different heights. For added speed and performance, the strong, lightweight alloy rims keep the weight down. Ride comfortably with beach cruiser pedals and insure safety with front and rear disc brakes. This bike ships ready to be assembled. Sized for adult riders 5 feet, 6 inches to 6 feet tall.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
